intro: Linosyris micropogon, commonly known as the narrow-headed linosyris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Linosyris micropogon is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
